thread.title: Sarah Ayton nominated for sailor of year award
thread.title_full: Sarah Ayton nominated for sailor of year award

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Sarah Ayton nominated for sailor of year award
text:
Follow us on Sarah Ayton nominated for sailor of year award A file photo of The Wave, Muscat’s Sarah Ayton in action during the 2015 Extreme Sailing Series Muscat Daily staff writer October 18, 2015 
Sarah Ayton, a two-time Olympic champion from Great Britain and a key member of Oman Sail's The Wave, Muscat (TWM), was recently shortlisted by the International Sailing Federation (ISAF) for the prestigious world sailor of the year award in the women's category. 
Sarah, an Extreme Sailing Series star, has shone throughout the 2015 series, guiding TWM to five victories from seven Acts. 
As the only woman crew member in the ESS fleet, the strong presence of the two-time Olympic gold medallists has been felt and her strategic ability aboard has seen her rise to the top, calling tactics on TWM. 
The ISAF last week announced five men and five women nominees for the awards. 
Set to be held on November 10 in Sanya, China, the awards ceremony will celebrate the world’s finest sailors' achievements during the qualifying period from the end of September in 2014 to August 31, 2015. 
Nominees: Men's award: Peter Burling (New Zealand), Blair Tuke (New Zealand), Loick Peyron (France), Giles Scott (UK), Ian Walker (UK), Ian Williams (UK); women's award: Sarah Ayton (UK), Sam Davies (UK), Elena Kalinina (Russia), Lotte Pedersen (Denmark), Charline Picon (France). Similar content
